burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.experiencereplay

Class FixedSizeMemory

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.behavior.singleagent.learning.experiencereplay.FixedSizeMemory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExperienceMemory

    public class FixedSizeMemory
extends Object
implements ExperienceMemory
    A straightforward implementation of a fixed size memory. When this memory already holds the fixed size of experiences and a new experience is added to it, it deletes the oldest memory to make room. The sample method will return a uniform random selection of memories with replacement, unless the number of stored memories is less than the requested number, in which case it will simply return all of the memories that it stores. Optionally, this memory may be set so that the the sampleExperiences(int) method always includes the most recent memory, which is useful when experience replay is used to augment more standard Q-learning approaches.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FixedSizeMemory

        public FixedSizeMemory(int size)
        Initializes with the size of the memory. The sampling method is *not* guaranteed to always include the most recent memory, and is a uniform random sampling from the stored memories.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of experiences to store

      • FixedSizeMemory

        public FixedSizeMemory(int size,
                       boolean alwaysIncludeMostRecent)
        Initializes with the size of the memory and whether the most recent memory should always be included in the returned results from the sampling memory.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of experiences to store
        alwaysIncludeMostRecent - if true, then the result of the sampleExperiences(int)} will always include the most recent experience and is a uniform random sampling for the n-1 samples. If false, then it is a pure random sample with replacement.

    • Method Detail

      • alwaysIncludeMostRecent

        public boolean alwaysIncludeMostRecent()
        If true, then the result of the sampleExperiences(int)} will always include the most recent experience and is a uniform random sampling for the n-1 samples. If false, then it is a pure random sample with replacement.
        Returns:
        true or false

      • setAlwaysIncludeMostRecent

        public void setAlwaysIncludeMostRecent(boolean alwaysIncludeMostRecent)
        Sets whether to always include the most recent experience in the sampleExperiences(int) method.
        Parameters:
        alwaysIncludeMostRecent - If true, then the result of the sampleExperiences(int)} will always include the most recent experience and is a uniform random sampling for the n-1 samples. If false, then it is a pure random sample with replacement.

        public void addExperience(EnvironmentOutcome eo)
        Description copied from interface: ExperienceMemory
        Adds an experience to the memory. Depending on the implementation, may implicitly cause the forgetting of other memories
        Specified by:
        addExperience in interface ExperienceMemory
        Parameters:

      • sampleExperiences

        public List<EnvironmentOutcome> sampleExperiences(int n)
        Description copied from interface: ExperienceMemory
        Samples up to n experiences from this memory. Depending on implementation fewer than n experiences may be sampled if the memory has less than n defined.
        Specified by:
        sampleExperiences in interface ExperienceMemory
        Parameters:
        n - the desired number of experiences to sample
        Returns:
        a list of of up to n experiences defiend with EnvironmentOutcome objects.
